newsitem.title: GERMANY: Porsche says German demand surges.
newsitem.headline: Porsche says German demand surges.

text.p: German sportscar maker Dr.Ing.h.c. Porsche AG said Friday that demand for its vehicles within Germany so far this year is stronger than it had expected.
Porsche said in a statement that incoming orders in the first nine months of its 1996/97 business year climbed 113 percent to around 7,000 vehicles.
The company had previously expected incoming orders to climb by about 80 percent, largely on demand for its new Boxster model.
Germany is Porsche's largest market in Europe and its second largest worldwide after the United States.
